info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 31 at 7:26PM EDT until August 1 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
.Minor flooding is occurring along Mississinewa River near Ridgeville as a result of over 2 inches of rainfall in that basin this morning. The river should fall back below flood stage overnight tonight.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
* WHEN...Until late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Lowland agricultural flooding along CR 100 W just north of the river. High water affecting a small portion of River Road just east of SR 1 and north of the river. Water is within a few feet vertically of the approaches to SR 1 bridge in western Randolph county.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EDT Thursday was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage overnight tonight to 4.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then rise to 4.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will fall to 4.5 feet early Saturday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 500 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT
